questions.text: Which of the following is true about the lymphatics of the vulva :

options.label: A
options.text: Do not cross the labio crural fold

options.label: B
options.text: Traverse labia from medial to lateral

options.label: C
options.text: Drain directly into deep femoral glands

options.label: D
options.text: Do not freely communicate with each other

questions.correct_answer: B. Traverse labia from medial to lateral
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Traverse labia from medial to lateral The lymphatics of each side freely communicate with each of them The lymphatics #difficultly cross beyond the labio crural fold The vulval lymphatics also anastomose with the lymphatics of the lower third of the vagina and drain into external iliac nodes Lymphatics from the deep tissues of the vulva accompany the internal pudendal vessels to the internal iliac nodes Superficial inguinal lymph node s are the primary lymph nodes that act as the sentinel nodes of the vulva. Deep inguinal lymph nodes are secondarily involved. It is unusual to find positive pelvic glands without metastatic disease in the inguinal nodes The gland of Cloquet or Rosenmuller, the uppermost deep femoral node, is absent in about 50 per cent of cases.

questions.text: Match the following with their lining epithelium:
Differentiation of genital ridge takes place at?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

2months Differentiation of genital ridge takes place at 6-10 weeks.

Highyeild:

Bipotential gonads at 5 weeks MALE GONADS BY 7 WEEKS MALE INTERNAL GENITALIA BY 10 WEEKS MALE EXTERNAL GENITALIA BY 12 WEEKS. The ovary develops by 8 weeks Fusion of Mullerian duct begins by 7-9 weeks and is completed by 12 weeks Intervening septum dissolves by 5th month

questions.text: What is the embryological origin of the cyst shown in the image?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Urogenital sinus. The diagnosis is the Bartholin cyst, which occupies a posterolateral position in the vulva. It arises from the Urogenital sinus.

questions.text: A 47-Year-old woman is diagnosed with Ca vagina localised to lower 1/3 of the vaginal canal. Now the doctor wants to check for LN metastasis. Which of the following LN biopsy will help to understand that?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Superficial inguinal nodes The superficial inguinal nodes receive lymph from the penis, scrotum, buttocks, labium majus, and the lower parts of the vagina and anal canal. These nodes have efferent vessels that drain primarily into the external iliac and common iliac nodes and ultimately to the lumbar (aortic) nodes. Lymphatic drainage of Vagina

questions.text: A 25 yr old P2L2 woman comes to gyneac OPD with complaints of itching in the genital area. The Consultant, while doing the PV examination, showed you a triangular area bounded by the clitoris, labia minora and fourchette. Which of the following openings are found in this area except?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Fossa navicularis The triangular space bounded by the clitoris, labia minora and fourchette is the vestibule. It is present between the labia minora anteriorly and the introitus posteriorly. The vestibule has 4 openings: Urethral opening (option a) Vaginal orifice opening (option b) Bartholin's duct on either side (option D) Ducts of paraurethral glands option E) The posterior part of the vestibule between the fourchette and the vaginal introitus is called fossa navicularis (option c).

Highyeild:

Bipotential gonads at 5 weeks MALE GONADS BY 7 WEEKS MALE INTERNAL GENITALIA BY 10 WEEKS MALE EXTERNAL GENITALIA BY 12 WEEKS. The ovary develops by 8 weeks Fusion of Mullerian duct begins by 7-9 weeks and is completed by 12 weeks Intervening septum dissolves by 5th month

Extraedge:

The vestibule has 4 openings: Urethral opening Vaginal orifice opening Bartholin's duct on either side Ducts of paraurethral glands

questions.text: A 35 yr old P1L1 Female comes to gyneac OPD with complaints of pain in the genital area. On PV examination, the following findings were revealed. Which of the following statements are true except about the affected structure?

options.label: A
options.text: Skene glands are affected due to obstruction of their duct

options.label: B
options.text: The duct of the affected structure opens between the hymen and labia minora

options.label: C
options.text: The affected structure secretes mucus with lubricants on sexual stimulation.

options.label: D
options.text: Infected abscess of the affected structure usually needs surgical drainage

questions.correct_answer: A. Skene glands are affected due to obstruction of their duct
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Skene glands are affected due to obstruction of their duct The image shows a Bartholin's cyst, which involves the Bartholin's glands (So option A is wrong). These glands are homologou s to the male bulbourethral or Cowper glands. The ducts of Bartholin's glands open in the groove between the hymen and the labia minora at approximately 5 and 7 o'clock positions. They are stimulated by sexual arousal. The glands contain columnar cells that secrete mucus with lubricant properties. Contraction of the bulbospongiosus muscle gland. Bartholin's cyst occurs due to obstruction of the ducts of the Bartholin's glands by proteinaceous material or due to infection. Symptomatic or recurrent cysts may require marsupialisation or gland excision. An infected Bartholin's cyst can lead to a Bartholin's abscess. This requires surgical drainage.

Highyeild:

Bipotential gonads at 5 weeks MALE GONADS BY 7 WEEKS MALE INTERNAL GENITALIA BY 10 WEEKS MALE EXTERNAL GENITALIA BY 12 WEEKS. The ovary develops by 8 weeks Fusion of Mullerian duct begins by 7-9 weeks and is completed by 12 weeks Intervening septum dissolves by 5th month

questions.text: A 35 yr old P1L1 Female comes to gynae OPD with complaints of pain in the genital area. On PV examination, the following findings were revealed. The below-given swelling has stretched the vulva and distal 1/3rd of the lateral vaginal wall. Which of the following nerve supply regarding the pain fibres in this condition are true except?

options.label: A
options.text: The sensory component of the pudendal nerve supplies the skin of the vulva, clitoris, perineum and lower vagina

options.label: B
options.text: The anterior half of the vulva is supplied by ilioinguinal

options.label: C
options.text: The posterior half of the vulva is supplied by the ilioinguinal nerve only

options.label: D
options.text: The anterior half of the vulva is supplied by genitofemoral nerves

questions.correct_answer: C. The posterior half of the vulva is supplied by the ilioinguinal nerve only
questions.explanation:
Solution:

The posterior half of the vulva is supplied by the ilioinguinal nerve only The posterior part of the vulva, including the perineum, is supplied by the posterior cutaneous nerve of the thigh The motor and sensory part of the somatic supply to the pelvic organs are through: Pudendal nerve—S2, S3, S4. Ilio- inguinal nerve—L1, L2. Genital branch of genitofemoral nerve—L1, L2. Posterior cutaneous nerve of the Pudendal nerve The sensory component supplies the skin of the vulva, external urethral meatus, clitoris, perineum and lower vagina. (option A) The motor fibres supply the perineal body's voluntary muscles, levator ani and sphincter ani externus. Levator ani, in addition, receives direct supply from S3 and S4 roots. While the anterior half of vulval skin is supplied by the ilioinguinal and genital branch of genitofemoral nerves (options b and d), the posterior part of the vulva, including the perineum, is supplied by the posterior cutaneous nerve of the thigh(option c is wrong).

Extraedge:

The ilioinguinal and genital branches of genitofemoral nerves supply mantra anterior half of the vulval skin. The posterior part of the vulva, including the perineum, is supplied by the posterior cutaneous nerve of the thigh

questions.text: Ureter is identified at operation by:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Peristaltic movement At operation ureter is recognised by: Its pale glistening appearance By a fine longitudinal plexus of vessels on its surface More particularly by its peristaltic movement By palpation between finger and thumb as a firm cord which , when escapes, gives a characteristic ‘snap’. Absence of pulsation does not serve to identify a structure as ureter because veins and obliterated umbilical arteries are also non-pulsatile.

Highyeild:

Bipotential gonads at 5 weeks MALE GONADS BY 7 WEEKS MALE INTERNAL GENITALIA BY 10 WEEKS MALE EXTERNAL GENITALIA BY 12 WEEKS. The ovary develops by 8 weeks Fusion of Mullerian duct begins by 7-9 weeks and is completed by 12 weeks Intervening septum dissolves by 5th month
